chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Larell Mitchell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, with 12 days credit for time served, with Huber for work release.  Court ordered the defendant to report to the House of Correction by 12:00 pm on Thursday, 3/19/15.

-Defendant to provide DNA sample.
-No Contact with victim.
-Defendant ordered to comply with sex offender registry for a period of 2 years.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larell Mitchell

records.addlTxt: Bail refund check packet.
Bail refund notice/affidavit sent 03/16/15.

Defendant Larell Mitchell in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Sentencing. Statements made by parties and defendant. Letter from defendant's employer received and filed. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Court ordered 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, with 12 DAYS credit for time served, with Huber for work release. 

Court ordered the defendant to report to the House of Correction by 12:00 pm on Thursday, 3/19/2015. 

-Defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges, to be paid from 25% of House of Correction funds, to be collected by the Department of Corrections, and to be paid by 9/14/2015. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

-Court ordered bail on deposit be applied to the court costs, fees, and surcharges. Any remaining bail is to be returned to the poster. 

-Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge. 

-Court ordered No Contact with the victim.

-Court ordered defendant to comply with the sex offender registry for a period of 2 years. 

-The court is NOT considering expunction for this matter.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post-conviction relief.

Filed
-Sentencing Referral Form
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.
Victim Impact Statement received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1 as AMENDED-
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court ordered the defendant to give a DNA sample following court proceedings today. Bail remains the same. Court vacated jury trial date of 2/23/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Larell Mitchell in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. On oral motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1 to be amended as follows:

COUNT 1- Fourth Degree Sexual Assault, contrary to sec. 940.225(3m) Wis. Stats., a Class A Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Larell Mitchell in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State requests an adjourned plea date for victim notification. Court grants request for adjournment. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 2/23/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Branch 25 is unable to hear this matter at 8:30 a.m. on 2/16/15. Parties notified. Case adjourned to 2/17/15 at 1:30 p.m. for Final Pre-Trial in Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Larell Mitchell in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case set for scheduling conference. Discussion regarding pending discovery issues. State will work on gathering the remaining discovery and turn over the materials to defense counsel. Court ordered this matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial to keep the case on track. Any motions are due by 12/01/14. Motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 26, 2031 at 09:00 am.

Scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Larell Mitchell in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Larell Mitchell in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.M.W (DOB 7/20/2002)

Defendant Larell Mitchell in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Larell Mitchell in custody.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court grants State's motion to orally amend the complaint.  Sentence 2 in paragraph 5 on page 1 should read "AMW would have turned 5 on July 2007."  NOT "AMW would have turned 5 on July 2002."
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
